qas.question: At what cross streets, marking the center of the Hospital Green of Yale - New Haven Hospital, do food carts congregate on weekdays?
What college of Yale is located at Elm and York Streets in New Haven?
What school of Yale is located nearest the intersection of Prospect and Sachem streets?
What New Haven non-profit manages the farmer's markets that service various neighborhoods weekly throughout the area?
How many lunch carts are there in Yale's Campus during lunchtime?
Who manages New Haven's farmers' market?
New Haven Hospital is located at where in Hospital Green?

context: During weekday lunchtime, <a4_0>over 150<a4_0/> lunch carts and food trucks from neighborhood restaurants cater to different student populations throughout Yale's campus. The carts cluster at three main points: by Yale – New Haven Hospital in the center of the Hospital Green (<a0_0><a6_0>Cedar and York streets<a6_0/><a0_0/>), by Yale's <a1_0>Trumbull College<a1_0/> (Elm and York streets), and on the intersection of Prospect and Sachem streets by the <a2_0>Yale School of Management<a2_0/>. Popular farmers' markets, managed by the local non-profit <a3_0>CitySeed<a3_0/>, set up shop weekly in several neighborhoods, including Westville/Edgewood Park, <a5_0>Fair Haven,<a5_0/> Upper State Street, Wooster Square, and Downtown/New Haven Green.
